Weather Wisdom

Snow mix makes for messy commute; warm-up coming

Secondary roads and highways west of Interstate 95 will become slippery and perhaps even dangerous for a few hours this evening, meteorologist Dave Epstein writes. (Boston.com, 3 p.m.)
Discuss: Plans for 60 degrees on Wed.

Weymouth man charged in assault with beer bottle on couple on Red Line train

Arrest made in alleged attack on Red Line

Joseph Pacheco tried to assault a father with a beer bottle after the mother asked assailant to move away from their daughter, police said. (Globe, 4:23 p.m.)

Senators unveil immigration reform plan

The proposal includes plans to secure the border, permit more guest workers, and create a path to citizenship for 11 million illegal immigrants already here. (AP, 4 p.m.)
  • White House praises Senate immigration plan
  • Discuss What do you think of the plan?

Boy Scouts may end ban on gays

Under the plan being considered, groups sponsoring Boy Scouts of America units would decide whether to open up their membership to gays. (AP, 2:29 p.m.)
  • Discuss Your thoughts on the proposed change
  • Boston Spirit Could the Scouts' ban on gays be over?

30 homeless after Taunton building fire

A fire that began between a building's walls prevented alarms from alerting apartment building residents Sunday night, fire officials said. (Boston Globe, 3:57 p.m.)

properties easier to get

Health & Wellness

Did you know ibuprofen can
cause kidney damage?

All medications can have side effects, and any medication can possibly cause an allergic reaction. And since acetaminophen can cause serious liver damage if too much is given, it's easy to think that ibuprofen is the safer choice.
